name: Teriyaki Chicken Bowl
steps:
Pat chicken thighs dry and season with salt and pepper on both sides.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook chicken thighs for 5-6 minutes per side until golden brown and cooked through (internal temperature 165Â°F).
While chicken cooks, prepare teriyaki sauce: combine soy sauce, mirin, brown sugar, grated ginger, and minced garlic in a small saucepan.
Bring sauce to a simmer over medium heat.
Mix cornstarch with water to create a slurry, then whisk into the sauce.
Simmer for 2-3 minutes until sauce thickens and becomes glossy.
Remove chicken from pan and let rest for 2 minutes, then slice into strips.
In the same pan, add a bit more oil if needed and stir-fry broccoli and carrots for 4-5 minutes until crisp-tender.
To serve: place rice in bowls, top with vegetables, then arrange sliced chicken on top.
Drizzle with teriyaki sauce and garnish with sesame seeds and sliced green onions.
